page.title: 18Transport around Hordley
page.content: This rural area, like so many others is poorly served by public transport. On Mondays to Fridays a bus runs from Oswestry to Shrewsbury via Hordley. It is convenient only for school pupils as it arrives at 0840 and leaves at 1620. The only other services are to Ellesmere market on Tuesdays, and on Wednesdays to Oswestry market. Just north of Lower Frankton, a bus runs regularly on the main road. The nearest railway station is 8km. away at Gobowen where trains run to Chester and Shrewsbury. The canal used to transport both goods and passengers but is now mainly a water feeder and tourist amenity.Transport is a problem unless you own a private car, and, to overcome this,a scheme has been set up whereby a rota of local drivers takes people on routine visits to hospitals, doctors or chemists.
